title: Even in his Moscow grave, Alexei Navalny is treated as an enemy
summary: The brutality displayed by the Russian authorities during the funeral of Navalny, who died in custody, turned the event into a protest: The crowd, denied access to its hero and pushed around by hundreds of police officers in riot gear, finally expressed its rage.

title: Israel agrees to framework for a Gaza cease-fire, as US airdrops begin
summary: International mediators have been working for weeks to broker a deal to pause the fighting before the Muslim holy month of Ramadan begins around March 10. A deal would likely allow aid to reach hundreds of thousands of desperate Palestinians in northern Gaza who aid officials worry are under threat of famine .

title: French foreign minister: 'The humanitarian situation in Gaza is creating indefensible and unjustifiable situations for which the Israelis are accountable'
summary: Stéphane Séjourné, France's new head of diplomacy, believes that 'France must be on the right side of history' regarding the war in Ukraine, and is calling for a 'lasting' ceasefire in the Palestinian enclave.

title: Germany to investigate a confidential army recording 'intercepted' by Russia
summary: The 'intercepted' file, a 38-minute audio recording of a conversation of German air force officers discussing potential strikes in Crimea with German-made Taurus missiles, had been shared on Russian social media by the head of the state-backed RT channel.

title: Sex education: French schools under pressure from conservative and far-right associations
summary: With France's first school program on emotional and sexual life due to be published shortly, groups opposed to the teachings are posting the names of schools that are organizing what they consider to be contentious sessions on social media.

title: From the 'Antoine Dupont effect' to Paris 2024, French sevens rugby is undergoing its own renaissance
summary: Long in the shadow of their rugby union 'cousin,' the French sevens team is enjoying unprecedented exposure just a few months ahead of the Olympic Games. The men's and women's teams are participating in the Los Angeles leg of the world circuit, from Friday to Sunday.

title: Trump wins Michigan primary in dominant show of force
summary: While the Michigan GOP has remained entrenched in division, chaos, and legal disputes, Saturday's convention showed that Trump remains the unifying force between the party's warring factions.

title: Lawyers seek nearly $6 billion in fees after Elon Musk pay ruling
summary: In a filing Friday with the Delaware Chancery Court, the three legal firms acknowledged the unprecedented size of the fees they are requesting but argued that winning the case in January provided "enormous benefits" to the carmaker.

title: The story of a street: Oberkampf, from working-class area to lively bric-a-brac
summary: It was home to metalworkers in the 19th century, to the wild nights of the 1990s and to the new millennium's gentrification. Step into the 11th arrondissement and wander along the local shops and trendy cafés of a Parisian street that has changed greatly, but never lost its soul.

title: Eight activists arrested after targeting French chemicals site
summary: France's industry minister Roland Lescure denounced the protest on Friday, declaring on social media platform X "Disagreeing and debating, yes. Destroying, no".

title: Javier Milei proposes a new 'social pact' to rebuild Argentina
summary: Lacking a parliamentary majority, the Argentinian president reached out to governors to support his 'May Pact' and his vast 'Omnibus' plan of libertarian reforms, in his first annual address to the country's congress on March 1.

title: Paris 2024 Olympics: Man sentenced to jail for stealing bag containing Paris traffic notes
summary: The accused was sentenced to 7 months jail for taking a bag which belonged to an engineer employed by Paris City Hall. The bag contained IT equipment which had been feared to contain sensitive information about security for the Paris Olympic Games.

title: Chad junta chief declares candidacy for May 6 presidential election
summary: Mahamat Idriss Deby Itno, a general who rose to power as Chad's transitional president after his father died in battle, has announced his aim to win an almost-certain election, after his main rival and cousin was shot by in an army assault on Tuesday, February 28.

title: Swedish parents say 'there's no such thing as bad weather, only bad clothes'
summary: As part of a series exploring parenting abroad, this week Le Monde looks at Sweden, where children's time outdoors is sacred. Whether in rain or snow, schoolchildren play outside from an early age – even napping outdoors.

title: EU releases €50 million to the UN agency for Palestinian refugees
summary: While the European Commission has given this agency, the UNRWA, a reprieve, other donors have remained divided over the future of their contributions. Some have waited for ongoing investigations to be completed, while others have proposed additional aid.

title: Paris 2024: Six months before they open, the Paralympic Games have mostly been overlooked
summary: With six months left before the opening ceremony, the Paralympics are plagued by a lack of media visibility. This is one of the many challenges the event's organizers will face over the coming months.

title: French intelligence services investigate pro-Russian campaign ahead of EU elections
summary: The DGSI is looking into a campaign led by a former far-right French MEP in the European elections in June, with links to several pro-Russian figures.

title: Real estate: Prices no longer adjust, they drop
summary: With a delay, the turnaround can be explained by a lower annual volume of transactions: it collapsed by 26% between 2021 and 2023 in France, according to data from the notaries.

title: Iris Apfel, known for her eye-catching style and her black-rimmed glasses, dies at 102
summary: The textile expert, interior designer, and fashion celebrity once said: 'I'm not pretty, (...) but it doesn't matter, I have something much better. I have style.'
